newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Randgold says Grootvlei strike ends.
newsitem.headline: Randgold says Grootvlei strike ends.

text.p: Randgold and Exploration Co Ltd said on Friday a strike at its Grootvlei Proprietary Mines Ltd gold mine had ended and had had a limited effect on production.

The company said in a statement employees -- on strike since Thursday's night shift -- returned to work after an agreement was reached between mine management and the National Union of Mineworkers (NUM).
Grootvlei general manager Neal Froneman said the strike action had had limited effect on production.
"Although no blasting took place, we were still able to treat material on stockpile and from excess rock from underground".
The mine produced 464 kg of gold in the three months to end-June.
Grootvlei, reported a net loss before capital spending of 29.16 million rand in the quarter to June 30 compared with a net loss of 1.5 million rand in the previous quarter.
